review: Solid unit. Very simple to set up. Smooth streaming. I have not found any CONS that have anything to do with the unit itself.My only problem has been with MY Cable Service Provider: Comcast/Infinty.They don't allow access to many of the Apps available on the Firestick. (History Channel, Showtime, etc.)Since you pay for these thru your Cable Service Provider, when you try to access these apps, they ask you to sync/activate with your service provider via computer. There's a large list (drop down menu) of service providers. Unfortunately, Comcast/Infinity isn't one of them.Again, not an Amazon problem ... I blame Comcast.But if you are a Prime Member, you can't go wrong with this item. My library comes right up. The remote is simple yet effective.
author: Wink "Wink"

review: I cannot believe I am getting the same thing as I did with my original Roku. I thought about giving it as a Christmas gift this year but nobody I knew needed one.  Very happy I kept it for myself.

review: Easy to set up. Plugged into my HDTV (had to use the connection device which was supplied) and power outlet. Entered my wifi password. Made a few setting changes on my HDTV to optimize. Entered my Amazon account and my Netflix account. Watched a couple shows from both Amazon Prime and Netflix. Very satisfied. I expected Amazon Prime to work, wasn't so sure about Netflix. However it all worked perfectly!
